Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.cli

Class InputParser

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.cli.InputParser
public class InputParser extends Object
This class has the task to parse the input from the user.

    • getSwapInt

      private Integer getSwapInt(MoveLocation location, String in)
      This method converts a string into an integer. The conversion is based on the move location.
      Parameters:
      location - the move location.
      in - the input of the user.
      Returns:
      the integer if the conversion is successful, null otherwise. the integer could represent the index of the student in the entrance or a student color.

    • parseConcludeChoice

      private void parseConcludeChoice()
      This method is used for parsing the input of the user when he wants to end an effect.

    • checkMove

      private boolean checkMove(MoveLocation from, int fromIndex, MoveLocation to, Integer toIndex, MoveActionRequest m)
      Helper method used for checking a move request.
      Parameters:
      from - the start location.
      fromIndex - indexes of students in the start location.
      to - the end location.
      toIndex - indexes of students in the end location.
      m - the request of the move.
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid, false otherwise.

    • checkMove

      private boolean checkMove(MoveLocation from, int fromIndex, MoveLocation to, Integer toIndex, MoveLocation getFrom, MoveLocation getTo, Set<Integer> getFromIndexesSet, Set<Integer> getToIndexSet)
      Helper method used for checking if the move is valid.
      Parameters:
      from - the start location selected by the user.
      fromIndex - the index of the student in the start location selected by the user.
      to - the end location selected by the user.
      toIndex - the index of the student in the end location selected by the user.
      getFrom - the start location.
      getTo - the end location.
      getFromIndexesSet - indexes of students in the start location
      getToIndexSet - indexes of students in the end location.
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid, false otherwise.

    • checkMoveChoice

      private MovedStudent checkMoveChoice(String[] in)
      This method is used for checking if the input is a valid move.
      Parameters:
      in - the input of the user.
